description: From Hindi बरकंदाज (barkandāj), from Persian برق انداز‎ (barq-andâz, literally “lightning-thrower”).

entries.meaning: (India, now historical) An armed guard or watchman.
examples: But unlike such forts as Chunar and Buxar […], the Carcanna was anything but a picturesque ruin: its turrets housed squads of sentries, and its parapets were manned by a great number of peons and burkundazes.
